intro: Swida drummondii, commonly known as Drummond's swida, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Rosaceae family, which includes roses and other related plants. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. It produces small, white or pinkish flowers that bloom in the spring. Its foliage consists of simple, alternate leaves with a rough texture.
